script.line: (rummage rummage rummage)
Prota! What brings you all the way out here to my landfill? Shoppin' for some vintage threads?
Oh, hey Randi! I'm looking for my dog, Minty. I think she came this way.

then.line: You wouldn't happen to have seen a dog carrying a sandwich, would you?
Well, I saw a dog. But what she was carryin'... that weren't no sandwich. That there was a crime against nature.
...Ha ha, yeah. Whoever made it must have been pretty confused!
Well, the bad news is, after I saw her, I lost track of her too!
Or at least that's what the riddle said. I think.
Well, the riddle weren't wrong! I did see your dog. But she booked it outta here in a hurry! I lost sight of her.
The teens at the skate park said maybe I should put myself in the trash, so here I am!
Hold on one gosh darn minute, they said that to you?
Yeah, they're pretty helpful once you get to know 'em.
Well listen. I got good news and bad news for ya, Prota. Good news, I saw your dog. Bad news, I lost track of the ol' girl.

script.line: Oh no. You don't think she's still here, do you? Maybe you could help me look?
I'd be delighted to, Prota! 'Cept I think you're goin' about whole thing all wrong.
Really?
Yeah! Look at you. You're comin' to the landfill, sniffin' around for a little dog. Like lookin' for a needle in a haystack! That's crazy!
You can't expect to find Minty if you're just gonna use those fleshy little orbs you call eyes!
Pardon me?
I know, I know, Vintage Viper like me s'posed to be old-fashioned, real traditional, and reverent towards our soft mortal bodies.
But welcome to the future, Prota! Everything's smart now. And if you want to really look for your dog, you need help.
You need...
ROBOT EYES.
I said "You need ROBOT EYES."
No, I heard you.
Well fortunately for you, Prota, the landfill's got everything you need to build the coolest, most tricked-out, kickbuttenest robot the world's ever seen.
You just need to go out and find a head, a body, and some legs, and I'll help you build the Minty-Finder 3000.
With futuristic laser eyes on our side, we'll track that dog down in two shakes of a robot lamb's metal tail.
Hmmm. That would be nice. Can't say I've had the best luck with new inventions today, but...
I'll start looking right away! And you know what they say: always dive in head first!
